description: The TOC Spectral reflectance refers to the portion of the incident energy reflected by the surface in a given spectral band and without atmospheric interferences. Because of the natural anisotropy of the land surface, reflectance depends on the illumination and viewing angular conditions. Therefore, to compare and use jointly successive observations, it is necessary to normalize the measurements into a same angular configuration. The resulting value is the normalized TOC reflectance.
title: Top Of Canopy Reflectance: global 10-daily (raster 1km) - version 1, Feb 2018

providers.name: Copernicus Land Monitoring Service
providers.description: Copernicus Land Monitoring Service - VITO NV
